mods.abstract: Page 76 of the album includes two photographs.; Photograph 1 [281] shows a man operating a Buckeye Steam Traction Ditcher to create an irrigation trench/ditch. The Buckeye Steam Traction Ditcher was patented by James B. Hill, a resident of Ohio who moved to Raceland, La. In 1914, where he developed seed corn and equipment to drain Louisiana swamplands.; Photograph 2 [282] shows tall leafy crops under a wooden slat canopy, man in a hat and suspenders stands among the crops.
mods.note: Compare Photograph 1 to the following publication. Hancock Historical Museum Association (1988, August 5) Buckeye Steam Traction Ditcher. Retrieved August 4, 2014, from https://www.asme.org/getmedia/53358c3a-ab48-4022-a07a-eefb0baeac56/133-Buckeye-Steam-Traction-Ditcher.aspx

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
